the state of the application should not be Stopped

Feature.Name: The test runner is not (very) important
Feature.Description:
In order to show that the test runner is just for the autogenerated stuff in SpecFlow  
	As a SpecFlow evanglist  
	I want to be able to call my steps in the same manner inspite of the testrunner configured

Steps.Name: I have step defintions in place
I call a step
the step should have been called

Feature.Name: Addition
Feature.Description:
In order to explain the order in which hooks are run
	As a SpecFlow evanglist
	I wan to  be able to hook into pre and post conditions in SpecFlow

the BeforeTestRun hook should have been executed

FeatureElements.Name: Hooking into pre conditions for Features in SpecFlow

Steps.Name: the scenario is running
the BeforeFeature hook should have been executed

FeatureElements.Name: Hooking into pre conditions for Scenarios in SpecFlow

Steps.Name: the scenario is running
the BeforeScenario hook should have been executed

FeatureElements.Name: Hooking into pre conditions for ScenarioBlocks in SpecFlow

Steps.Name: the scenario is running
the BeforeScenarioBlock hook should have been executed

FeatureElements.Name: Hooking into pre conditions for Steps in SpecFlow

Steps.Name: the scenario is running
the BeforeStep hook should have been executed

Feature.Name: Tag demonstrator
Feature.Description:
In order to show the capabilities of tags in SpecFlow
	As a SpecFlow evanglist
	I want to write scenarios that has tags and show their usage in code

Steps.Name: that my scenario has the @ignore tag
I run the scenario
the scenario is ignored
the missing step definitions are not reported
that my scenario has 0 tags
I run the scenario
before scenario hook with '' is run
that my scenario has 1 tags
I run the scenario
before scenario hook with 'testTag1' is run
that my scenario has 3 tags
I run the scenario
before scenario hook with 'testTag1, testTag2, testTag3' is run
that my scenario has 2 tags
I run the scenario
before scenario hook with 'testTag1, testTag3' is run

Feature.Name: Injecting context into step specifications
Feature.Description:
In order to don't have to rely on the global shared state
		and to be able to define the contexts required for each scenario.
	As a SpecFlow Evanglist
	I would like to have the system automatically inject an instance of any class as 
		defined in the constructor of a step file

Steps.Name: a feature which requires no context
everything is dandy
a feature which requires a single context
the context is set
a feature which requires multiple contexts
the contexts are set
a feature which requires a recursive context
the context is set
its sub-context is set
a feature which requires a single context
the context is set
the context was created by the feature with a single context scenario

Feature.Name: Sample Markdown Feature
Feature.Description:
Header 1
========

Header 2
--------

This is a *significant* word

1. Ordered #1
2. Ordered #2
3. Ordered #3

- Unordered #1
- Unordered #2
- Unordered #3

Horizontal Rule:
- - -

Table example:

| First Header  | Second Header |
| ------------- | ------------- |
| Content Cell  | Content Cell  |
| Content Cell  | Content Cell  |

- - -

Including a picture: ![](./image.png)

FeatureElements.Name: Sample Markdown Scenario Example
FeatureElements.Description:
This is **important** text

Code Block:

```
var x = 2;
```

Apple
:   Pomaceous fruit of plants of the genus Malus in
    the family Rosaceae.
:   An American computer company.

Orange
:   The fruit of an evergreen tree of the genus Citrus.

Steps.Name: this
that

Examples.Description: This __message__ is important too and is for an *Example* table.

Feature.Name: Arithmetic
Feature.Description:
In order to avoid silly mistakes
As a math idiot
I want to be able to perform arithmetic on the calculator

When $a \ne 0$, there are two solutions to $\(ax^2 + bx + c = 0\)$ and they are
$$x = {-b \pm \sqrt{b^2-4ac} \over 2a}.$$

Steps.Name: I have entered 50 into the calculator

StepComments.Text: # In the DHTML version, the description will be rendered with mathematical formulas if the experimental features are enabled.

Steps.Name: I have entered 70 into the calculator
I press add
the result should be 120 on the screen
I have entered 50 into the calculator
I have entered 70 into the calculator
I press subtract
the result should be -20 on the screen
I have entered 50 into the calculator
I have entered 70 into the calculator
I press multiply
the result should be 3500 on the screen
I have entered 50 into the calculator
I have entered 2 into the calculator
I press divide
the result should be 25 on the screen
